title: Grade 2 Mathematics
teaser: Students extend understanding of base-ten notation, fluency with addition and subtraction, standard units of measure, and describing and analyzing shapes.

children.title: Sums and Differences to 20
children.teaser: Students practice the new required fluencies. Students also represent and solve word problems using addition and subtraction.

children.title: Foundations for Fluency with Sums and Differences Within 100
children.teaser: Students make significant progress towards fluency with sums and differences within 20.

children.title: Number Bonds of Ten
children.teaser: Students make number bonds of ten.

children.title: Number Bonds of Ten: A Focus on Subtraction
children.teaser: Students make number bonds through ten with a subtraction focus and apply them to one-step word problems.

children.title: Initiating Fluency with Addition and Subtraction Within 100
children.teaser: Students solve problems by decomposing and composing units.

children.title: Adding Within 20
children.teaser: Students make a ten to add within 20.

children.title: Adding and Subtracting Within 20
children.teaser: Students make a ten to add and subtract within 20.

children.title: Decomposition to Subtract Within 20
children.teaser: Students decompose to subtract from a ten when subtracting within 20, apply to one-step word problems.

children.title: Strategies for Addition and Subtraction Within 100
children.teaser: Students revisit their addition and subtraction skills, practicing with larger numbers up to 100.

children.title: Addition and Subtraction Within Multiples of 10
children.teaser: Students add and subtract within multiples of ten based on understanding place value and basic facts.

children.title: Add Within 100 Using "Make A Ten"
children.teaser: Students add within 100 using properties of addition to make a ten.

children.title: Decomposition to Subtract Within 100
children.teaser: Students decompose to subtract from a ten when subtracting within 100 and apply this to one-step word problems.

children.title: Addition and Subtraction of Length Units
children.teaser: Students measure, estimate, and solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of length.

children.title: Understand Concepts About the Ruler
children.teaser: Students establish an understanding of distance on a ruler and the ruler as a number line.

children.title: Connecting Measurement and Physical Units
children.teaser: Students connect measurement with physical units by using multiple copies of the same unit to measure.

children.title: Using Iteration to Measure
children.teaser: Students use iteration with one physical unit to measure.

children.title: Creating and Using Rulers
children.teaser: Apply concepts to create unit rulers and measure lengths using unit rulers.

children.title: Measure and Estimate Length Using Different Measurement Tools
children.teaser: Students measure various objects and develop estimation strategies.

children.title: Centimeter Rulers and Meter Sticks
children.teaser: Students measure various objects using centimeter rulers and meter sticks.

children.title: Estimating Length Using Benchmarks
children.teaser: Students develop estimation strategies by applying prior knowledge of length and using mental benchmarks.

children.title: Measure and Compare Lengths Using Different Length Units
children.teaser: Students use different length units to measure and compare lengths.

children.title: Measure and Compare Lengths Using Standard Units (Continued)
children.teaser: Students measure and compare lengths using centimeters and meters.

children.title: Measure and Compare Lengths Using Nonstandard Units (Continued)
children.teaser: Students measure and compare lengths using standard metric and non-standard units; relate measurement to unit size.

children.title: Relate Addition and Subtraction To Length
children.teaser: Students relate addition and subtraction to length, choosing appropriate tools and strategies to solve word problems.

children.title: Addition and Subtraction Using the Ruler
children.teaser: Students solve addition and subtraction word problems using the ruler as a number line.

children.title: Comparing Length
children.teaser: Students measure lengths of string and create tape diagrams to represent and compare the lengths.

children.title: Applying Conceptual Understanding of Measurement
children.teaser: Students apply conceptual understanding of measurement by solving two-step word problems.

children.title: Place Value, Counting, and Comparison of Numbers to 1,000
children.teaser: Students work with metric units, i.e. centimeters and meters, to support upcoming work with place value concepts.

children.title: Forming Base Ten Units of Ten, Hundred, and Thousand
children.teaser: Students repeatedly bundle 10 ones to make 1 ten and subsequently bundle 10 tens to make 1 hundred.

children.title: Base Tens and Hundreds
children.teaser: Students bundle and count ones, tens, and hundreds to 1,000.

children.title: Understanding Place Value Units of One, Ten, and a Hundred
children.teaser: Students practice counting by ones and skip-counting by tens and hundreds, counting efficiently and effectively.

children.title: Counting Up and Down Using Ones and Tens
children.teaser: Students count up and down between 100 and 220 using ones and tens.

children.title: Counting Up and Down Using Ones, Tens, and Hundreds
children.teaser: Students count up and down between 90 and 1,000 using ones, tens, and hundreds.

children.title: Three-Digit Numbers in Unit, Standard, Expanded, and Word Forms
children.teaser: Students continue counting and practice moving fluidly between the word form, unit form, standard form, and expanded form.

children.title: Count Up to 1,000 on the Place Value Chart
children.teaser: Students count up to 1,000 on the place value chart.

children.title: Three-Digit Numbers in Unit Form
children.teaser: Students write base ten three-digit numbers in unit form and show the value of each digit.

children.title: Base Ten Numbers in Expanded Form
children.teaser: Write base ten numbers in expanded form.

children.title: Base Ten Numbers in All Forms
children.teaser: Write, read, and relate base ten numbers in all forms.

children.title: Modeling Base Ten Numbers Within 1,000 with Money
children.teaser: Students move back and forth from money to numerals, making connections to place value.

children.title: The Value of $1, $10, and $100 Bills
children.teaser: Students count the total value of $1, $10, and $100 bills up to $1,000.

children.title: $10 to $1000 on Place Value Chart and Empty Number Line
children.teaser: Students count from $10 to $1,000 on the place value chart and the empty number line.

children.title: The Number of $10 in $1000
children.teaser: Students determine how many $10 bills can be exchanged for a $1,000 bill.

children.title: Modeling Numbers Within 1,000 with Place Value Disks
children.teaser: Students transition to the more abstract place value disks that are used through Grade 5 for modeling very large and very small numbers.

children.title: Ones, Tens, and Hundreds with Place Value Disks
children.teaser: Students count the total value of ones, tens, and hundreds with place value disks.

children.title: Making Change
children.teaser: Students learn to exchange 10 ones for 1 ten, 10 tens for 1 hundred, and 10 hundreds for 1 thousand.

children.title: Reading and Writing Numbers Within 1000
children.teaser: Students read and write numbers within 1,000 after modeling with place value disks.

children.title: Modeling Numbers with More Than 9 Ones or Tens
children.teaser: Students model numbers and write them in all forms.

children.title: More Than 9 Groups of 10
children.teaser: Students explore a situation with more than 9 groups of ten.

children.title: Comparing Two Three-Digit Numbers
children.teaser: Students compare and order three-digit numbers.

children.title: Using <, >, and =
children.teaser: Students compare two three-digit numbers using <, >, and =.

children.title: Compare Numbers Using <, >, and =
children.teaser: Students compare numbers using <, >, = when there are more than 9 ones or tens.

children.title: Order Numbers in Different Forms
children.teaser: Students order numbers in different forms.

children.title: Finding 1, 10, and 100 More or Less Than a Number
children.teaser: Students work with the concepts "more than" and "less than."

children.title: Using Language and Models for More and Less
children.teaser: Students use language and model 1, 10, and 100 more and 1, 10, and 100 less.

children.title: Modeling More and Less When Changing The Hundreds Place
children.teaser: Students model 1, 10, 100 more and 1, 10, 100 less when changing the hundreds place.

children.title: Counting Up and Down
children.teaser: Students complete a pattern counting up and down.

children.title: Addition and Subtraction Within 200 with Word Problems to 100
children.teaser: Students add and subtract within 200 to deepen understanding of base-ten, place value, and properties of operations.

children.title: Sums and Differences Within 100
children.teaser: Students build upon their understanding of the base ten system and their prior knowledge of place value strategies.

children.title: Relate "1 More/Less" and "10 More/Less" to Addition and Subtraction
children.teaser: Students elate 1 more, 1 less, 10 more, and 10 less to addition and subtraction.

children.title: Adding and Subtracting Multiples of 10
children.teaser: Students add and subtract multiples of 10 including counting on to subtract.

children.title: Adding and Subtracting Multiples of 10, Some Within 100
children.teaser: Students add and subtract multiples of 10 and some ones within 100.

children.title: Adding and Subtracting Multiples of 10, Some Within 100 (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to add and subtract multiples of 10 and some ones within 100.

children.title: Solving Problems Within 100 Using Place Value
children.teaser: Students solve one- and two-step word problems within 100 using strategies based on place value.

children.title: Strategies for Composing a Ten
children.teaser: Students work on the addition algorithm.

children.title: Manipulatives Representing Composition of 10 Ones as 1 Ten
children.teaser: Use manipulatives to represent the composition of 10 ones as 1 ten with two-digit addends.

children.title: Relate Addition Using Manipulatives to a Written Vertical Method
children.teaser: Students relate addition using manipulatives to a written vertical method.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Composition and Relating Drawings to Written Method
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent the composition and relate drawings to a written method.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Composition When Adding Two- and Three-Digit Addends
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent the composition when adding a two-digit to a three-digit addend.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Composition When Adding Two- and Three-Digit Addends
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent the composition when adding a two-digit to a three-digit addend.

children.title: Strategies for Decomposing a Ten
children.teaser: Students work on the subtraction algorithm.

children.title: Represent Subtraction With Manipulatives
children.teaser: Students represent subtraction with and without the decomposition of 1 ten as 10 ones with manipulatives.

children.title: Relate Manipulative Representations to a Written Method
children.teaser: Students relate manipulative representations to a written method.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Subtraction With and Without Decomposition
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent subtraction.

children.title: Represent Subtraction When There is a Three-Digit Minuend
children.teaser: Students represent subtraction with and without the decomposition when there is a three-digit minuend.

children.title: Represent Subtraction When There is a Three-Digit Minuend (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to represent subtraction with and without the decomposition when there is a three-digit minuend.

children.title: Solve One- and Two-Step Problems Using Place Value Strategies
children.teaser: Students solve one- and two-step word problems within 100 using strategies based on place value.

children.title: Strategies for Composing Tens and Hundreds
children.teaser: Students move towards mastery of strategies for composing tens and hundreds.

children.title: Relating Compositions of 10 Tens as 1 Hundred
children.teaser: Students relate compositions of 10 tens as 1 hundred to 10 ones as 1 ten.

children.title: Using Manipulatives to Represent Additions with Two Compositions
children.teaser: Students use manipulatives to represent additions with two compositions.

children.title: Relate Manipulative Representations to a Written Method
children.teaser: Students relate manipulative representations to a written method.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Additions With Compositions
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent additions with compositions and relate drawings to written method.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Additions With Compositions (Continued)
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent additions with compositions and relate drawings to written method.

children.title: Solving Additions With Up to Four Addends
children.teaser: Students solve additions with up to four addends with and without two compositions of larger units.

children.title: Strategies for Decomposing Tens and Hundreds
children.teaser: Students move towards mastery of strategies for decomposing tens and hundreds.

children.title: Use Number Bonds to Subtract From The Hundred
children.teaser: Students use number bonds to break apart three-digit minuends and subtract from the hundred.

children.title: Manipulatives With Decompositions:  1 Hundred as 10 Tens
children.teaser: Students use manipulatives with decompositions of 1 hundred as 10 tens, 1 ten as 10 ones.

children.title: Relate Manipulative Representations to a Written Method
children.teaser: Students relate manipulative representations to a written method.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Subtraction With Up to Two Decompositions
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent subtraction with up to two decompositions.

children.title: Subtract From 200, From Numbers With Zeros in Tens Place
children.teaser: Students subtract from 200 and from numbers with zeros in the tens place.

children.title: Subtract From 200, From Numbers With Zeros in Tens Place (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to subtract from 200 and from numbers with zeros in the tens place.

children.title: Student Explanations of Written Methods
children.teaser: Students think about and discuss the multiple strategies they have learned to represent and solve addition and subtraction problems.

children.title: Explain Totals Below Method Using Words, Math Drawings, and Numbers
children.teaser: Students use and explain the totals below written method using words, math drawings, and numbers.

children.title: Compare Totals Below to New Groups Below As Written Methods
children.teaser: Students compare totals below to new groups below as written methods.

children.title: Solve Two-Step Word Problems Within 100
children.teaser: Students solve two-step word problems within 100.

children.title: Addition and Subtraction Within 1,000 with Word Problems to 100
children.teaser: Students extend conceptual understanding of addition and subtraction algorithms to numbers within 1000.

children.title: Strategies for Adding and Subtracting Within 1,000
children.teaser: Students practice the simplifying strategies they learned in Module 4, but with numbers up to 1,000.

children.title: Relate 10/100 More and 10/00 Less to Addition and Subtraction.
children.teaser: Students relate 10/100 more and 10/100 less to addition and subtraction of 10 and 100.

children.title: Add and Subtract Multiples of 100, Counting On to Subtract
children.teaser: Students add and subtract multiples of 100 including counting on to subtract.

children.title: Add Multiples of 100 and Some Tens Within 1,000
children.teaser: Students add multiples of 100 and some tens within 1,000.

children.title: Subtract Multiples of 100 and Some Tens Within 1,000
children.teaser: Students subtract multiples of 100 and some tens within 1,000.

children.title: Associative Property to Make a Hundred In One Addend
children.teaser: Students use the associative property to make a hundred in one addend.

children.title: Associative Property: Subtract From Three-Digit Numbers, Verify With Addition
children.teaser: Students use the associative property to subtract from three-digit numbers and verify solutions with addition.

children.title: Strategies For Varied Addition and Subtraction Problems Within 1,000
children.teaser: Students share and critique strategies for varied addition and subtraction problems within 1,000.

children.title: Strategies for Composing Tens and Hundreds Within 1,000
children.teaser: Students compose tens and hundreds within 1,000.

children.title: Relate Manipulative Representations to the Addition Algorithm
children.teaser: Students relate manipulative representations to the addition algorithm.

children.title: Relate Manipulative Representations to the Addition Algorithm (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to relate manipulative representations to the addition algorithm.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Additions and Relating Drawings to Addition Algorithm
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent additions and relate drawings to the addition algorithm.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Additions and Relating Drawings to Addition Algorithm (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to use math drawings to represent additions and relate drawings to the addition algorithm.

children.title: Choose and Explain Solution Strategies, Record With Written Method
children.teaser: Students choose and explain solution strategies and record with a written addition method.

children.title: Strategies for Decomposing Tens and Hundreds Within 1,000
children.teaser: Students focus on decomposing tens and hundreds within 1,000.

children.title: Relate Manipulative Representation to the Subtraction Algorithm
children.teaser: Students relate manipulative representations to the subtraction algorithm, use addition to explain why subtraction method works.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Subtraction With Up to Two Decompositions
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent subtraction with decompositions, relate drawings to the algorithm.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Subtraction With Up to Two Decompositions (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to use math drawings to represent subtraction with decompositions, relate drawings to the algorithm.

children.title: Subtract From Multiples of 100
children.teaser: Students subtract from multiples of 100 and from numbers with zero in the tens place.

children.title: Subtract From Multiples of 100 (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to subtract from multiples of 100 and from numbers with zero in the tens place.

children.title: Alternate Methods for Subtracting From Multiples of 100
children.teaser: Students apply and explain alternate methods for subtracting from multiples of 100 and from numbers with zero in the tens place.

children.title: Student Explanations for Choice of Solution Methods
children.teaser: Students synthesize their understanding of addition and subtraction strategies, determining which of those strategies to apply to various of problems.

children.title: Student Explanations for Choice of Solution Methods
children.teaser: Students choose how to solve a problem and explain their method.

children.title: Student Explanations for Choice of Solution Methods (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to select and explain problem-solving methods.

children.title: Foundations of Multiplication and Division
children.teaser: Students extend understanding of a unit to build the foundation for multiplication and division wherein any number can be a unit.

children.title: Formation of Equal Groups
children.teaser: Students learn to create and work with equal groups.

children.title: Use Manipulatives to Create Equal Groups
children.teaser: Students use manipulatives to create equal groups.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Equal Groups and Relating Repeated Addition
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to represent equal groups, and relate to repeated addition.

children.title: Math Drawings Representing Equal Groups and Relating Repeated Addition (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to use math drawings to represent equal groups, and relate to repeated addition.

children.title: Represent Equal Groups and Relate to Repeated Addition
children.teaser: Students represent equal groups with tape diagrams, relate to repeated addition.

children.title: Arrays and Equal Groups
children.teaser: Students organize equal groups (from Topic A) into rectangular arrays.

children.title: Compose Arrays From Rows and Columns
children.teaser: Students compose arrays from rows and columns, and count to find the total using objects.

children.title: Decompose Arrays Into Rows and Columns
children.teaser: Students decompose arrays into rows and columns, and relate to repeated addition.

children.title: Represent Arrays and Distinguish Rows Using Math Drawings
children.teaser: Students represent arrays and distinguish rows and columns using math drawings.

children.title: Create Arrays Using Square Tiles With Gaps
children.teaser: Students create arrays using square tiles with gaps.

children.title: Word Problems Involving Addition of Equal Groups
children.teaser: Students solve word problems involving addition of equal groups in rows and columns.

children.title: Rectangular Arrays as a Foundation for Multiplication and Division
children.teaser: Students deepen their understanding of spatial structuring by building and partitioning rectangles with rows and columns of same-size squares.

children.title: Square Tiles to Compose a Rectangle, Relate to Array Model
children.teaser: Students use square tiles to compose a rectangle, and relate to the array model.

children.title: Square Tiles to Compose a Rectangle, Relate to Array Model (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to use square tiles to compose a rectangle, and relate to the array model.

children.title: Use Math Drawings to Compose A Rectangle With Square Tiles
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to compose a rectangle with square tiles.

children.title: Use Square Tiles to Decompose A Rectangle
children.teaser: Students use square tiles to decompose a rectangle.

children.title: Partition A Rectangle Into Same-Size Squares, Compose Arrays With Squares
children.teaser: Students use scissors to partition a rectangle into same-size squares, and compose arrays with the squares.

children.title: Partition A Rectangle With Square Tiles, Relate to Repeated Addition
children.teaser: Students use math drawings to partition a rectangle with square tiles, and relate to repeated addition.

children.title: Use Grid Paper to Create Designs to Develop Spatial Structuring
children.teaser: Students use grid paper to create designs to develop spatial structuring.

children.title: The Meaning of Even and Odd Numbers
children.teaser: Students explore the meaning of even and odd numbers, learning various interpretations and relating these interpretations to addition.

children.title: Relate Doubles To Even Numbers
children.teaser: Students relate doubles to even numbers, and write number sentences to express the sums.

children.title: Pair Objects and Skip-Count to Relate Even Numbers
children.teaser: Students pair objects and skip-count to relate to even numbers.

children.title: Investigate Pattern of Even Numbers and Relate to Odd Numbers
children.teaser: Students investigate the pattern of even numbers in the ones place, and relate to odd numbers.

children.title: Use Rectangular Arrays to Investigate Odd and Even Numbers
children.teaser: Students use rectangular arrays to investigate odd and even numbers.

children.title: Problem Solving with Length, Money, and Data
children.teaser: Students learn to work with various types of units within the contexts of length, money, and data.

children.title: Problem Solving with Categorical Data
children.teaser: Students sort objects and information into categories, learning that organizing information makes problem-solving easier.

children.title: Sort and Record Data Into A Table
children.teaser: Students sort and record data into a table, counting by category to solve a problem.

children.title: Draw and Label a Picture Graph to Represent Data
children.teaser: Students draw and label a picture graph to represent data with up to four categories.

children.title: Draw a Bar Graph to Represent Data
children.teaser: Students use a bar graph to represent data.

children.title: Draw a Bar Graph from Given Data Set
children.teaser: Students draw a bar graph to represent a given data set.

children.title: Solve Word Problems Using a Bar Graph
children.teaser: Students solve word problems using data presented in a bar graph.

children.title: Problem Solving with Coins and Bills
children.teaser: Students solve problems involving coins and bills.

children.title: Recognizing the Value of Coins
children.teaser: Students recognize the value of coins and count up to find their total value.

children.title: Word Problems Involving the Total Value of Coins
children.teaser: Students solve word problems involving the total value of a group of coins.

children.title: Word Problems Involving the Total Value of Bills
children.teaser: Students solve word problems involving the total value of a group of bills.

children.title: Word Problems Involving Coin Combinations With the Same Total Value
children.teaser: Students solve word problems involving different combinations of coins with the same total value.

children.title: Using Fewest Number of Coins to Make Given Value
children.teaser: Students use the fewest number of coins to make a given value.

children.title: Different Strategies to Make $1 or Make Change from $1
children.teaser: Students use different strategies to make $1 or make change from $1.

children.title: Word Problems Involving Different Ways to Make Change from $1
children.teaser: Students solve word problems involving different ways to make change from $1.

children.title: Word Problems Involving Totals Within $100 or $1
children.teaser: Students solve two-step word problems involving dollars or cents with totals within $100 or $1.

children.title: Creating an Inch Ruler
children.teaser: Students reinforce the measurement concepts and skills learned in Module 2 while focusing on customary units.

children.title: Connect Measurement With Physical Units Using Inch Tiles
children.teaser: Students connect measurement with physical units by using iteration with an inch tile to measure.

children.title: Apply Concepts to Create Inch Rulers and Measure Lengths
children.teaser: Students apply concepts to create inch rulers and measure lengths using them.

children.title: Measuring and Estimating Length Using Customary and Metric Units
children.teaser: Students explore measurement using both customary and metric units.

children.title: Measure Various Objects Using Inch Rulers and Yardsticks
children.teaser: Students measure various objects using inch rulers and yardsticks.

children.title: Develop Estimation Strategies By Applying Prior Knowledge of Length
children.teaser: Students develop estimation strategies by applying prior knowledge of length and using mental benchmarks.

children.title: Measure An Item Twice Using Different Length Units
children.teaser: Students compare measurement of an item using different units and relate measurement to unit size.

children.title: Compare the Differences in Length Using Inches, Feet, and Yards
children.teaser: Students measure to compare differences in length using inches, feet, and yards.

children.title: Problem Solving with Customary and Metric Units
children.teaser: Students solve word problems using length, identify unknown numbers on a number line, and use the ruler as a number line.

children.title: Solve Word Problems Involving Length By Using Tape Diagrams
children.teaser: Students solve two-digit addition and subtraction word problems involving length by using tape diagrams.

children.title: Identify Unknown Numbers On A Number Line Diagram
children.teaser: Students identify unknown numbers on a number line diagram by using the reference points.

children.title: Represent Sums and Differences Involving Length By Using The Ruler
children.teaser: Students represent two-digit sums and differences involving length by using the ruler as a number line.

children.title: Displaying Measurement Data
children.teaser: Students connect the process of measuring to displaying data in line plots.

children.title: Collect and Record Measurement Data In a Table
children.teaser: Students collect and record measurement data in a table.

children.title: Draw Line Plot to Represent Measurement Data
children.teaser: Students draw line plot to represent measurement data.

children.title: Draw a Line Plot, Answer Questions Based on Measurement Data
children.teaser: Students draw a line plot to represent a given data set.

children.title: Draw a Line Plot, Answer Questions Based on Measurement Data (Continued)
children.teaser: Students continue to draw line plots to represent given data.

children.title: Time, Shapes, and Fractions as Equal Parts of Shapes
children.teaser: Students investigate, describe, and reason about the composition and decomposition of shapes to form other shapes.

children.title: Attributes of Geometric Shapes
children.teaser: Students continue to develop their geometric thinking from Grade 1, progressing from a descriptive to an analytic level of thinking, where they can recognize and characterize shapes by their attributes and properties.

children.title: Describe Two-Dimensional Shapes Based on Attributes
children.teaser: Students describe two-dimensional shapes based on attributes.

children.title: Build, Identify, and Analyze Two-Dimensional Shapes With Specified Attributes
children.teaser: Students build, identify, and analyze two-dimensional shapes with specified attributes.

children.title: Draw Different Polygons Including Triangles, Quadrilaterals, Pentagons, and Hexagons
children.teaser: Use attributes to draw different polygons including triangles, quadrilaterals, pentagons, and hexagons.

children.title: Draw Different Quadrilaterals Including Rectangles, Rhombuses, Parallelograms, and Trapezoids
children.teaser: Students use attributes to identify and draw different quadrilaterals including rectangles, rhombuses, parallelograms, and trapezoids.

children.title: Relate the Square to the Cube, Describe Cubes Attributes
children.teaser: Students relate the square to the cube.

children.title: Composite Shapes and Fraction Concepts
children.teaser: Students build and partition composite shapes, exploring fraction concepts as they identify the relationships between parts and wholes.

children.title: Combine Shapes to Create a Composite Shape and New Shapes
children.teaser: Students combine shapes to create a composite shape and create a new shape from composite shapes.

children.title: Interpret Equal Shares In Composite Shapes As Halves, Thirds, Fourths
children.teaser: Students interpret equal shares in composite shapes as halves, thirds, and fourths.

children.title: Interpret Equal Shares In Composite Shapes As Halves, Thirds, Fourths (Continued)
children.teaser: Students interpret equal shares in composite shapes as halves, thirds, and fourths.

children.title: Halves, Thirds, and Fourths of Circles and Rectangles
children.teaser: Students focus on partitioning circles and rectangles into equal fractional parts.

children.title: Partition Circles and Rectangles Into Equal Parts and Describe Them
children.teaser: Students partition circles and rectangles into equal parts, describe those parts as halves, thirds, or fourths.

children.title: Partition Circles and Rectangles Into Equal Parts and Describe Them
children.teaser: Students partition circles and rectangles into equal parts, describe those parts as halves, thirds, or fourths.

children.title: Describe A Whole By The Number Of Equal Parts
children.teaser: Students describe a whole by the number of equal parts including halves, thirds, and fourths.

children.title: Recognize Equal Parts Of An Identical Rectangle Has Different Shapes
children.teaser: Students recognize that equal parts of an identical rectangle can have different shapes.

children.title: Application of Fractions to Tell Time
children.teaser: Students apply fraction and skip-counting skills to telling time.

children.title: Construct A Paper Clock
children.teaser: Students construct a paper clock by partitioning a circle into halves and quarters.

children.title: Tell Time To The Nearest Fives
children.teaser: Students tell time to the nearest five minutes.

children.title: Relate A.M. and P.M. To Time Of Day
children.teaser: Students tell time to the nearest five minutes, relating a.m. and p.m. to time of day.

children.title: Solve Elapsed Time Problems Involving Whole and Half Hours
children.teaser: Students solve elapsed-time problems involving whole hours and a half hour.
